author: Special Correspondent
text:
New facility:Chief Minster Jayalalithaa inaugurated the new office building on the premises of Ramanathapuram Collectorate on Saturday.

Chief Minister Jayalalithaa inaugurated through video conferencing a three-storey combined office building on the Collectorate premises here on Saturday.

After the Chief minister inaugurated the building, built at a cost of Rs. 11 crore, and a modern AstroTurf hockey stadium, Collector S. Natarajan lit the ‘kuthuvilakku’ at the new complex in the presence of the Collectorate staff and general public.

MP A. Anwar Raja, District Revenue Officer Ali Akbar, Project Director, District Rural Development Agency, A Palani, Assistant Executive Engineer, PWD (Buildings), Kuruthivel Maran, District Panchayat Union Chairman M. Sundarapandian and Municipal Chairperson Santhanalakshmi were present.

The Public Works Department (PWD) has built the ground plus three floor complex with a total plinth area of 6894.49 square metres and escalator facilities.

The building work was started in May 2014 and completed the construction in February this year, well within the project period.

The Collector’s chamber, his secretariat, office of Information and Public Relations Department and various government offices, presently functioning in rented buildings outside the master plan complex would move into the new building, official sources said.

Circuit House

The Chief Minister also inaugurated through video conferencing a Circuit House in Rameswaram island.

The ground and first floor building have been constructed at a cost of Rs. 2.23 crore, official sources said. The PWD completed the construction in less than a year after taking up the work in March last year.
title: Chief Minister inaugurates combined office building
